isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - Before 12/06/1994 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - THERMOSTATIC CONTROL SWITCH

step1.para: Make sure key switch and A/C switch are OFF.
Remove cover from the passenger side of the instrument panel.
Remove the cover from the heater/evaporator unit.
Disconnect two wiring connectors from the thermostatic control switch.

note.para: Before disconnecting wires, note circuit number locations to assure correct reassembly.

step1.para: Remove the thermostatic control switch mounting screws and remove the switch from the bracket.
Pull the insulating tape away from the capillary tube. Pull the capillary tube straight down out of the evaporator core and housing unit.
Withdraw the thermostatic control switch capillary tube from the evaporator core and housing ( Item 1, Figure 26).

note.para: Service installation is different than the Production installation.

step1.para: Establish access by moving the heater core out of the way. DO NOT disconnect the heater hoses. Remove the screws from the top of the heater core flange and from the lower outer tab ( Figure 12). The heater core lower inner tab has a fork type slot that fits under the button head rivet on the lower inner frame of the housing. Reach into the housing and get your fingers behind the inner seal and core. Pull straight outward until the tab fork is clear of the button rivet head.

caution.para: Use care not to bend the tab or reassembly will be difficult.

step1.para: Move the heater core to the right and tie it to the housing ( Figure 25).

figure.caption: Figure 25. Heater Core Tied Back for Access
Figure 26. Installation of Capillary Tube in the Evaporator Core

step1.para: Remove the air filter cover and the filter.
Push the capillary tube through the insulating tape and along the inner side of the evaporator core ( Figure 27).

figure.caption: Figure 27. View of the Capillary Tube Through the Air Filter Opening

step1.para: Bend the tip of the capillary tube at 4.0 inches (102 mm) at approximately 30 degrees past a right angle.
Push the capillary tube tip through the evaporator core fins at a point 1.0 inch (25 mm) in from the core flange and 9.75 inches (248 mm) up from the bottom ( Figure 27).
Look at the front of the evaporator core through the air filter opening ( Item 1, Figure 26). The tip must be protruding through the fins.
Reach in with your finger and bend the tip of the tube so it is flush with the surface of the fins.
Replace the air filter and the filter cover.
Position the switch on the bracket and install the switch mounting screws.
Install the heater core as follows:

step2.para: Make sure the gaskets are in place on the ends of the heater core.
Align the slot in the heater core frame with the rivet at the front of the housing and push the core into position.
Install the heater core mounting screws.

step1.para: Connect the wiring connectors to the thermostatic control switch. Make sure the connectors are located properly.
Check the operation of the thermostatic control switch.
Replace the covers on the Blend-Air unit and the instrument panel.
